From the New York Times: How to Help Your Child Succeed at School
"A successful experience in school is not only about report cards. Ideally your child will learn how to learn, retain information, think independently, ask questions and develop an increasing sense of competence. Here are some guidelines for making sure you start on the right foot and keep enthusiasm and momentum high throughout the school year:

Do
Focus on the process, not the product.
Encourage kids to self-advocate.
Keep a long-term perspective.
Maintain a healthy sleep schedule.
Love the child you have, not the child you wish you had.
Don’t
Overschedule.
Worship grades.
Encourage helplessness.
Compare kids to one another.
Love kids based on their performance.

From Parent Toolkit: "Watching the news, we see the significant challenges that our connectedness can bring—terrorism, epidemics, and cyber threats, just to name a few. Schools like mine now must teach “21st Century Skills” that include maxims like “There is no delete,” and “Nothing is private.” But, with our help, I believe our children ought to be more hopeful than fearful.

"Yes, in our connected world, one terrible or reckless moment can do significant harm, but imagine the intentional good that one thoughtful moment might also be able to produce. Odyssey of the Mind is a creative out-of-the-box competition that’s ranges from 1st grade all the through college. Ridgeline is proud to send its very first team to the World Finals. This team, coached by Ms. Brooks-Taylor, has been working on its solution since August of 2019. Their problem, was to create a network device that transmits a text message, an image, and en email through various devices. The skit they created you will see their problem and solution, acted out by Tara Duncan, Mayra Kruk, Zac Revel, Makayla Fowler, and Andrew Moore.

This team placed third at their Regional Tournament on February 29th and advanced to the State Finals which were to be held at the end of March. Because of COVID-19, they were able to advance to the virtual World Finals Tournament.

In total, there are 843 teams competing in the five different problems. For more information about Odyssey of the Mind go to odysseyofthemind.com or email Ms. B-T at abrooks-taylor@ridgelineacademy.org. #knowandgrow

post_text: We would like to introduce Marcel Santelli as a coach in both our girls and boys basketball programs. Marcel has been working alongside His Father Peter Ezugwu, founder of Future Stars who spent more than 13 years as a professional basketball player, since he was a teen. His passion for helping kids excel on and off the court is infectious. Recently, Marcel moved to Italy where he fostered a deep appreciation for other cultures, while he continued to coach and play at the next level in a European basketball league. Returning to Arizona, Marcel is thrilled to have launched his own programs through Gold Standard Sports Academy, and looks forward to positively impacting the lives of young people all over Phoenix. “I am Excited to head up Ridgeline’s High School Girls' Basketball program and work within the Boys' program, as well. I'm looking forward to growing these athletes on and off the court. I can’t wait to get to work! Lots of Positivity coming our way, and we are ready to spread our wings and Fly. Get ready Eagles!” #knowandgrow #ridgelineproud #ridgelineeagles

***Practices start JUNE 16th, not July***

Is your child interested in participating in a Ridgeline sports team? Cross Country running is a sport in which teams and individuals run a race on open-air courses over natural terrain such as dirt or grass. Whether your child has a passion for running, or just wants to get in shape for another sport, cross country is a great sport that pushes the body to its limits. 4th Grade races are 1 mile, middle-school races are 1.5 miles, and high school races are 3.1 miles, so in order to prepare, we will run anywhere from 1-6 miles at practices. Practices will be both on and off school campus. Races will typically take place on Saturday mornings, but could be another day (the schedule is not yet complete).

If your child is interested in participating or even just trying it out to see how they like it, please use the google form to sign them up. Please contact Coach Toussaint with any questions: btoussaint@ridgleineacademy.org

Sign up here: https://rb.gy/u8h0fa

From First Things First: How to Establish a Family Quiet Time

"Some people saw the title and thought, “Yeah right. There’s just no way. You haven’t been to my house. You don’t know my kids.”

"I am just one of the latest work-at-home dads who is amazed at just how much activity, noise, and energy can be expended by my co-inhabitants. Who are the co-inhabitants? Two daughters (7 & 13), 5 sons (ages 5 months – 11 yrs), 1 wife (can’t put her age, it’s a violation of the code). That’s eight other people. Noise is the default. Not having some quiet time is not an option either. Otherwise, I’m really gonna lose my mind.

"I’m not going to try and convince you on the importance of quiet time. I haven’t met a parent yet who doesn’t crave it when they are home all day with their children. I’m just going to empower you to establish a quiet time."

Click the link to find out how you can establish your own family quiet time!

https://firstthings.org/how-to-establish-a-family-quiet-time/

Welcome to Ridgeline, Tawnya Mecham, our Ridgeline High School Principal! Tawnya Mecham comes to Ridgeline with over 20 years experience in education. She has taught every grade from Kindergarten to 12th, and has served as high school principal for the last 6 years. For several years she volunteered as PTO president, and as a chair on the Site Council. Tawnya has been a founding member directly involved with opening three schools and has served as a charter school board member for 6 years.

Academically preparing students for their future is her passion. She believes all students can be successful. Helping them discover their own passions and assisting them achieve their goals is her motivation.

Mrs. Mecham is excited to bring her passion and commitment to Ridgeline and be a part of their innovative vision for education. She is thrilled to be a part of an organization that shares her values in building a culture of community support and involvement.
#knowandgrow #ridgelineproud #ridgelinehighschool
